intro: Anacardium occidentale var. gardneri, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces hard-shelled fruits that contain edible seeds, which are commercially valuable as Brazil nuts. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
